result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert E Lenkawski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert E Lenkawski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert E Lenkawski was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Submit an apology in way and manner to be determined by agent.
Continue counseling and cooperate with treatment providers and case worker.  Take all medications as prescribed and only in the amount and frequency prescribed. 

PRSO-141783 case dismissed and read-in for purposes of sentencing.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert E Lenkawski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:45 pm - Defendant Robert E Lenkawski appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states agreement.  DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct. 2.    Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  Comments by M.A.L. Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct. 2 and on motion of DA dismisses Ct. 1.  Comments by M.A.L. Comments by parties.  Court dismisses and reads-in uncharged PRSO - 141783 for purposes of sentencing.  
Court imposes: (Ct. 2) - Sentence withheld - 1 year probation. Conditions: $243 court costs; $750 Rest + 10% surcharge ($75) = $825; $65 SBDA; Apology; Continue counseling and cooperate with treatment providers and case worker; Take medications as prescribed and only in the amounts and frequency prescribed.  Court orders defendant to PCSD to submit DNA sample. Appeal rights given. Adj. 3:02 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 31, 2015 at 11:00 am.
see minutes on today's date under preliminary hearing event

11:11 am - Defendant Robert E Lenkawski appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver form provided to Court.  Court questions defendant regarding waiver.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court finds waiver is given freely and accepts.  DA files information.  Parties have received and reviewed and waive reading.  Defendant pleads NOT GUILTY to charges.  Bond to continue.  Adj. 11:13 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 16, 2014 at 11:00 am.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

Defendant Robert E Lenkawski appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
